element_texts.text: Completed

At sister Conant's
Warwick Sept 10th 1853
My Dear Son, I wrote to you last week but think I'll write again because I do want answer from you directly so that I can know whether you are coming & if you are coming--when so as to make my calculations accordingly--If you don't want to come, or think it not expedient to come--you need not consider it necessary for you to, on my account for I can go back alone without any difficulty or danger I think.--Tho' it might be pleasanter to have company.
If any thing should prevent your coming and I do not hear from you before that time I think I shall start for home about the 25 of this month You need not feel that it is any great affair or needs any great preparation--you can come from Bangor here in 24 hours at the cost of about 4, or 4,50 & you won't want to stay more than a week you can see all the folks you'll want to see--as long as you'll want to see them--I have been down on the Brook one day which is all I care about it is so long since I've seen 'em much & I feel so unacquainted that I don't care to stay any where except with sisters
When I came I left the Greenfield port at Grants and got into the Brattleborough Cars & came on to Northfield and Mr. Parsons  brought me out here You can do the same or stop at Wendall which is about as near here if I could know just when you'd come I guess I could get Mariah to go down there after you
Completed

now do be sure to write by the very next mail and let me know your calculations and all about it  Conclude what, and when, and how you'll do and let me know & set about it immediately.
I don't think you'll want to stay more than a week so that you need not be gone more than 10 days or so from home. Your things at home won't get very much out of fix in that time if you can't leave them just as you would wish.
Perhaps you have written & I may receive a letter from you before you get this but if you have written I want you should write again and by the very next mail. Good bye.
A.M. Metcalf
